Suggest you look at the following book:

"Biomimicry for Optimization, Cont=
rol, and Automation", by Kevin M. 
Passino, Springer 2005, ISBN 1852338040.=


Specifically,

1) Sectiion 6.3 Planning Strategy Design, page 241
2) Sect=
iion 9.2 Function Approximation as Learning, page 342
3) Sectiion 9.3.6 Onl=
ine Function Approximation: Dynamic Learning, page 
369
4) Sectiion 12.1 St=
rategies for Adaptive Control, page 549
5) Sectiion 12.3 Indirect Adaptive =
Neural/Fuzzy Control, page 553
6) Sectiion 16 Evolution and Learning: Syner=
gistic Effects, page 719
7) Sectiion 19 Competitive and Intelligent Foragin=
g, page 829

Good luck!

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "qmjasim" <n2opower@.=
..> wrote:
>

e trying

> inputs are con=
stantly changing and it is highly unlikely that the same
> set of inputs wi=
ll ever be repeated.

nario and would it

ow long would it
